title: Nishapur Capital of the Seljuk Empire
Champa Rice
description: At the turn of the 11th century, Champa Rice was more readily produced, sold, and cultivated which led to proto-industrialization within Asia.
effectText: Either 1 card regains all health, or every card on your field gains 1 health

title: Gunpowder
description: Supposedly stumbled upon by men who were looking for the key to everlasting life, gunpowder went from a way of celebrating life, to changing the way in which death would spread for eternity.
effectText: All armies + 3 atk or remove 1 card from the game permanently

title: Civil Service Exam
description: A Song dynasty test which established a meritocracy within China and served both the upper and lowers classes...so they say. This tradition carried on over the course of centuries.
effectText: Summon one Champion without meeting prerequisites. Remove this card from the field when the summonned Champion perishes.

title: Dar Al Islam
description: Sometimes translated as “House of Peace” and other times as,  “House of Islam”, this term refers to the rise of Diasporic Islam, and where it became the dominant force in shaping culture around the globe.
effectText: Search your deck for 2 Divine cards and place them in your hand. One Divine card may be played this turn. This card remains on the field until one of the cards retained has fallen in battle.

title: Foot Binding
description: An aristocratic practice in which the female foot was repeatedly mended and broken to prevent natural growth. This became a sign of social status.
effectText: All female cards are immoble as long as this card is present on the field. This card is removed after 3 completed turns.

title: Typhoon
description: Also known as the “Divine Wind”, this prevented the Mongols from invading Japan during the 13th century.
effectText: If your opponent controls any Mongol armies, send them to the memorial. If your opponent does not control any Mongol cards, no army cards may attack for 1 turn. (this and your opponent’s)

title: Monsoon Winds
description: While an initial force that made it difficult to navigate the Indian Ocean, Scholars such as Ibn Khaldun helped understand the winds. Leading to an opportunity where trade could once again flourish.
effectText: One Ocean Card may attack twice this round. (Including attacking the player twice if no champions are present). This card is removed after 2 turns or if one Ocean/Sea based card is destroyed

title: Bubonic Plague
description: A disease originating from China, made its way to Europe by 1323. The Bubonic Plague is also known as the Black Death, which led to certain death within days.
effectText: Destroy One Foundation card or Two armies from your opponnents space

title: Pax Mongolica
description: Pax Mongolica or Mongolian Peace followed the death of Genghis Khan during the 13th and 14th Century. Trade increased, as did the influence of Mongolian Rule.
effectText: Neither player may attack for this turn. Retrieve one card from your memorial and place it back into your hand. This card is removed from the field following this turn.

title: Mandate of Heaven
description: Utilized to justify rebellions and rule, the Mandate of Heaven indicates whose side God has chosen to succeed during a war or rebellion.
effectText: When one Army card or Champion would typically fall in battle, they remain on the field for one additional turn. This card is removed from the field following the effect. (can be face down/ activated during opp. turn)

title: Sphere of Influence
description: One of the many forms of Imperialism, a Sphere of Influence leads to direct control of a smaller country’s ability to develop and organize.
effectText: Prevent your opponent from drawing a card for 1 turn. This card is removed from the field after your opponent's turn.

title: Cultural Revolution
description: Led under the guidance of Chairman Mao, the Cultural Revolution revitalized Nationalism and Ideologies within China.
effectText: As long as this card remains on the field, all Divine, Noble cards do 1/2 damage. This card is removed from the field after 2 complete turns.

title: Silk Road
description: A trade network between Eurasia, connecting China to Europe. While it is not technically one road, this trade network has existed for nearly 2000 years. Through this road, trade cities such as Kashgar and Desert Oases flourish.
effectText: You may draw one additional Foundation Card. Both players may look at their next three cards. Discard this card at the end of this turn.

title: Proselytize
description: As religion continued to spread throughout the world, the affects it had on culture and politics began to take shape. Leaders would proselytize those in different parts of the world, in an attempt to gain power, and influence in new areas.
effectText: Any Divine cards on this side of the field gain +2 HP. This card is removed from the field in 3 turns. Until then, any new Divine cards drawn are also affected.

title: Tribute
description: Tributary systems have been used globaly throughout the years. Sometimes the tribute or tax came in the form of money, for others it was goods and resources. Some even gave up their children to appease the dominant power.
effectText: Place one of your cards on the field of your opponents

title: House of Wisdom
description: The House of Wisdom was established under Harun Al Asadi and became a staple of Baghdad architecture and scholarships. Scholars, educators, and philsophers would travel from across the world to study at the center of learning.
effectText: Gives any Scholar, +2 stats in each category. This card is removed as the chosen card perishes.

title: Carpa Nan
description: The intricate roads developed by the Incans. These served as trade routes, and opportunities to show off an emperor's wealth.
effectText: You may look through the next three cards on your deck and rearrange them in the order you like.

title: Theocracy
description: A form of government which is dictated by religion. Examples are Sharia law, Aztec Empire
effectText: All Nobility and Divine gain +1 ATK instantly. This card remains on the field until one Nobility or Divine card perishes.

title: Pilgrimage to Mecca
description: The Hajj is a pilgrimage made to the Kaaba within the city of Mecca. It is a sacred journey that every practicing Muslim must make at least once in their life.
effectText: You may return two Divine cards from the memorial to your hand.

title: Janissaries
description: An elite group of Ottoman soldiers utilized during the 14-19th century.  Initially part of the Devshirme system in which children were given to the ruling government, the Janissaries became a powerful military unit.
effectText: Take control of one of your opponenets cards for 2 turns. This card remains on the field until the targeted card is destroyed.

title: Devshirme
description: A child levy or blood tax. This system was instilled by the Ottoman Empire which allowed them to recruit soldiers, political leaders. Typically those taken were of Christian descent.
effectText: Take control of one of your opponent’s Army cards. This Army remains on your side until it perishes. This card is removed from the field until the Army perishes

title: Smallpox
description: Smallpox arrived in the Americas by the Spanish in the 16th century. There are stories that smallpox was explicityly spread through blankets and other goods given to the indigenous people.
effectText: All cards on the opposing player’s field lose 1 HP. (only once) This card remains on the field for 3 turns.

title: Manifest Destiny
description: A term first used to promote the annexation of territories such as Texas and Oregon. Not only was conquering America justified, but it was inevitable.
effectText: Destroy two of your opponent’s foundation cards or draw two foundation cards from your deck. This card remains on the field for three turns.

title: Diaspora
description: A term used to describe the dispersion of a people. Sometimes seen to describe the Jewish people following mass exodus movements, other times it describes the mass exodus of Muslims during times of war.
effectText: Find one card in your deck that shares the same prerequisites as a card in play. You may play that card insantly. This card remains on the field until the newly drawn card is destroyed.

title: Nationalism
description: Emerging from the 18th and 19th century, nationalism would lead to revolutions, unity, superioirty complexes, war, and patriotism.
effectText: Resurrect 2 army cards from your memorial.

title: Imperialism
effectText: Claim one of your opponents land cards as your own for one complete turn

title: Social Darwinism
description: A sociological argument that justified the abuse of lower class and minority figures through modifiying Charles Darwins’ theory of Evolution to fit the social structures of society.
effectText: If any champions have equal to or less ATK stats than your champion cards, they may not attack for two turns. This card is discarded following two turns.

title: Scramble for Africa
description: As European Nations continued to divide up African territories, the inhabitants and their land were slowly devoured by the Europeans.
effectText: Destroy two army cards from your opponent’s field permanently. This card remains on the field for three turns.

title: Berlin Conference
description: Held between 1884-1885, European nations sought to establish legal claims over African territories. This moment in history would lead to new world powers and new opportunities for enslavements and opression.
effectText: Claim one opponent's army card as your own. This card remains on the field until the chosen Army card perishes. The Army card returns to the opponent's memorial when it falls.

title: Opium
description: After nearly 10 million citizens became addicted to the British Import of Opium, the Chinese established a prohibition of the buying and selling of Opium. This would lead to the Opium Wars and would change China's economic practices for centuries.
effectText: One card of your opponent may not attack for 2 turns. Remove this card from the field after two rounds have passed.

title: Black Hand
description: A secret military society formed in 1901 by officers in the Army of the Kingdom of Serbia. The group was responsible for the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand...after many failed attempts
effectText: Choose one Nobility card to target. You must flip a coin and guess properly. If you fail, this card remains on the field for 3 turns, and the opponent does not lose any HP when that card perishes in battle. If you succeed this card returns to your deck, and the targetted card instantly perishes.

title: Atomic Bomb
description: Developed in America under the title of the Manhattan Project. The Atomic Bomb would be used to decimate Hiroshima and Nagasaki. The creation of this bomb led to the Cold War between 1945-1991.
effectText: Destroy all foundation cards on the field, both yours and your opponent's.

title: Economic Miracle of Japan
description: A term used to describe the post war economic growth of Japan amidst the Cold War. Japan became the second-largest economy in the world, second only to the United States
effectText: Withdraw any three cards from your memorial. This card remains on the field until the three cards have been placed back onto the field.

title: Military Industrial Complex
description: In the midst of the 20th century, countries sought to create "forever wars". Through these forever wars, an entirely fresh economy emerged, one based on militarism.
effectText: All army cards on this side of the field are impervious to damage for 2 turns. This card remains on the field for 3 rounds.

title: Partition
description: The abdication of the Indian territory by British Government  in 1947 was rushed and left dissary in geo-political movements. In the midst of the creation of Pakistan, millions would die, and see abuse.
effectText: You may choose one card on the arena to be discarded, if it is your opponent’s card, they do not lose any Player HP, if it is your own card, you gain 1HP.

title: Iranian Revolution
description: Following the coup de tat of the United States, the traditionalist leaders of Iran transformed the country into the ideals that most seperated themselves from Western Culture
effectText: If your opponent controls your card, place it back on your field, with +2 ATK. This card is removed from the field when the card in action is destroyed.

title: Suez Canal
description: A ten year project that officially opened in 1869, the artifical sea level waterway in Egypt would connect the Red Sea and the Mediterrranean Sea. 12% of global trade passes through this canal in the modern era.
effectText: Have your opponents place their next card from the deck onto your arena. It can be played no matter what. Army, Champion, or resource card. This card remains your arena for two turns, then returns to the Opponent’s arena unless it is discarded/destroyed

title: Pueblo Revolt
description: The Pueblo Revolt of 1680, also known as Popé's Rebellion, was an uprising of most of the indigenous Pueblo people against the Spanish colonizers in the province of Santa Fe de Nuevo México,
effectText: If any army card on your opponent's field has more than 3 ATK, 1/2 the number.

title: A'ishah al Ba- uniyyah
description: 1460-1507 "The sun and the moon appeared on the horizon of my spirit and the heart behold what eyes could not see..." A'ishah is one of the most notable writers of all time whose prose expanded Sufi literature.
effectText: When summoned, you may view the next three cards of your deck and re order them in anyway you'd like

title: Akbar Mughal Emperor
description: 1542-1605 Akbar the Great, leader of the Mughal Empire led one of the msot prominent Gunpowder Empires in history. He created stability in his empire through the acceptance of religion, cultures, and syncretism.
effectText: Replace any card's stats on your field with the stats of one of your opponent's card.

title: Al Razi
description: 854-925 a Persian phsyician, philosopher, and mathmatician. He established foundational medicine and surgery techniques during the Golden Age of Islam
effectText: When this card is summoned, choose one card to gain full HP ( You may choose an opponent's card as well)

title: Ana Nazing
description: 1583-1663 Ana Nzinga would rule the Ambundu Kingdoms of Ndongo located in modern day Angola. Her kingdom serves as a sanctuary for runaway slaves.

title: Atahualpa
description: The Sun God who reigned the Incan empire in 1532, he would be remembered as the last Incan Emperor. Following a civil war, Atahualpa met his demise at the hands of Spanish Conquistador Francisco Pizarro.
effectText: When targetting any Explorer card, multiply your ATK stat x2

title: Bartolomeu Dias
description: 1450-1500 A portuguese explorer who became the first European to navigate the southern tip of Africa. This set the stage for future explorers.
effectText: This card gains +1ATK stat for any cards on the field that are explorers (including opponent's field)

title: Cecil Rhodes
description: 1853-1902 A British Colonialist and mining magnate. Cecil sought to control Africa from Cairo to Cape Town. He controlled the diamond mines, trade routes, and institutions throughout Africa
effectText: If any cards of your opponent's field only require 1 army, destroy them instantly and they lose health accordingly.

title: Charlotte corday
description: Charlotte Corday was deemed the Angel of Assassinatino as she sought to put an end to the French Revolution by assassinating Jean Paul Marat. Some see her as a French Subject attempting to do good, others blame her for the corruption of Maximillian Robespierre
effectText: Deal 3x ATK damage towards Revolutionist Champions.

title: Emperor Meiji
description: 1852-1912 Emperor Meiji was the 122nd Emperor of Jpana and rose to power in the late 19th century. This era became a turning point for Japan, industrializing, and  Imperializing to compete with the rest of the world.
effectText: You may choose to wipe the board clean, forcing all cards in the memorial and field to be placed back into your deck to start over (as well as opponents). Your HP remains the same.

title: Emperor Shunzhi
description: 1643-1661 Taking the throne at the age of five, Shunzhi was the first Emperor of the Qing Dynasty. He would be seen as noble by some, and a puppet by others
effectText: This card's ATK and DEF multiply for every different type of Foundation card on your field (up to 3. Fields must be present before summoned)

title: Francisco Pizarro
description: 1485-1547 Pizzaro was a Spanish Conquistador, best known for his expeditions that led to the conquest of Peru. It was through his actions that Atahualpa would be captured and tortured.
effectText: Take control of any past or present event/resource/foundation card and place it on your field (substitute one event card if two are already in play)

title: Genghis Khan
description: 1155-1227  Hero. Villain. He's the guy with a Bow. Genghis Khan controlled the largest land empire in history, from the tip of Japan to Europe.
effectText: Struck with fear, one opponents card cannot attack for one turn. If you have three seperate types of Foundation cards on the field, Khan gains +1 hp

title: Harun Al Rashid
description: 766- 809 The Fifth Abbasid Caliphate who established the House of Widsom in Baghdad. He is often featured within the stories of the Arabian Nights.
effectText: All Desert cards (excluding this card) gain 2 ATK bonus. If this card is defeated- 1hp is taken away from your opponent's HP.

title: Hernan Cortes
description: 1485-1547 A spanish conquistador who was mistaken for a God. Cortes would eventually capture Moctezuma and lead to the end of the Aztec Empire.
effectText: All Earth and Ocean cards gain x2 attack bonus for one turn, but lose 2 HP.

title: Hong xiuquan
description: 1814-1864 Leader of the Chinese revolutionary party against the Qing Dynasty, known as the "heavenly king". He led one of the bloodiest civil wars of world history after claiming to be the brother of Jesus Christ.
effectText: Sacrifice one of your own army cards on the field and discard one opponent's card from the field (Foundation and Resource/event cards included)

title: Ibn battuta
description: 1304-1369 One of the greatest explorers of all time. A man who travelled more than 117,000 km and is comparable to that of Zheng He and Marco Polo by his cultural achievements.
effectText: You may draw one card from your memorial and place it in your hand OR view the next five cards of your deck and place them in any order you wish.

title: Ibn Khaldun
description: 1332-1406 Khaldun is an Arabian scholar and one of the greatest historians of all time. His research would shed insight on the population, environment, and health which helped establish fields of historiography.
effectText: This card takes the ATK of any past opponent card currently in the memorial. However after 2 turns, this card's attack becomes 0 once again.

title: Ibn sina
description: 980-1037 "There are no incurable diseases- only the lack of will". One of the greatest Philosphers, Doctors, and Mathematicians of the Middle East, his achievements would influence the research of astronomy, humanism, and theology.
effectText: Destroy one army card on your field to instantly heal one Champion or Army Card.

title: Ismael I
description: 1487-1524. Ismael I established a dynasty that would rule over Iran for more than 200 years, and become one of the greatest gunpowder empires
effectText: This card is affected by all resource/event card boosts for 1 turn present on either side of the field. After player's attack phase, destroy all resource cards on yours and opponent's field.

title: J. Robert Oppenheimer
description: 1904-1967 J. robert Oppenheimer was an American theoretical physicist who helped develop the Atomic Bomb during the Manhattan Project.
effectText: When this card is attacked, the opposing card is dealt radioactive damage. They lose 1 additional HP.

title: Jean Paul Marat
description: 1743-1793 Marat was a political theorist, physician, scientist, philosopher and revolutionist. He was a vigorous defender of the sans-culottes and published his views in Friend of the People.
effectText: All cards present on the field alongside this card gain 2x attack towards any Nobility card.

title: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
description: 1712-1778 Rousseau was a social contract theorist and philosopher. He admired the noble savage and felt that man is a slave to soceity and is everywhere in chains.
effectText: Instantly destroy one Nobility card on your opponent's field. Add +2 ATK to all revolutionists on your side of the field.

title: Jesus of Nazareth
description: 4 BCE- 33CE Seen as a Jewish immigrant who spread the teaching of christianity, the son of God, or a heretic, Jesus would transform the landscape of religion for centuries.
effectText: If an opponent's Divine card declares an attack while this card is in your hand, this card may be brought to the field without meeting prerequisites and take any potential damage for that card. This card then remains on the field. If this card perishes in battle, it may return in 3 turns for 1 complete turn.

title: Karl marx
description: 1818-1883 Marx was a German philosopher, economist, historian, and political theorist. His best-known titles are the 1848 pamphlet The Communist Manifesto and Das Kapital.
effectText: For every revolutionist on the field, this card games +1 in all stats (HP, ATK, DEF)

title: khadijah
description: 556-619 "Mother of believers" was the first wife of the Prophet Mohammad. She is considered one of the Four Ladies of heaven along with Mary, Asiyah, and Fatima.
effectText: As long as this card is present on the field, all Opponent Champion ATK and DEF stats are switched. Stats return to normal when this card falls.

title: King leopold II
description: 1835-1909Leopold II was the second King of the Belgians and the self-made ruler of the of the Congo Free State. His actions led to one of the most devestating genocides Africa has ever seen.
effectText: When this card is summoned onto the field, your next champion card may be placed without meeting prerequisites.

title: Kublai Khan
description: 1215-1294 Known as the "Wise Khan" he was grandson to Genghis Khan and conqueror of the Song Dynasty. He would go on to develop the Yuan Dynasty.
effectText: If Kublai Khan is present on the field along with Desert, Earth, and Water foundations, the opposing player loses one health point.

title: Louis xiv
description: 1638-1715 "I am the state" The Great Sun King of France, helped develop dance and led to the creation of the Palace of Versailles costing billions of dollars
effectText: Draw two additional cards and place them in your hand.

title: Louis XVI
description: 1754-1793 Monarch during the French revolution. He was known for enjoying elaborate parties and his dedication towards hobbies rather than his people.
effectText: Force your opponent to discard three cards in their hand.

title: Mansa musa
description: 1280-1337 Ruler of the Mali Empire, Mansa Musa was said to have so much gold, he destroyed the economy of towns as he made his pilgrimige to Mecca.
effectText: Place one card from your opponent's memorial on your field for one turn.

title: Mao Zedong
description: 1893-1976 Mao Zedong established the Communist rule in China. Under his rule China established the Great Leap Forward, as well as the Cultural Revolution
effectText: If this card is attacked while in defense position. You may destroy one opponent's foundation card, draw one of your own, and gain 1 atk. However, if this card stays on the field for more than 2 turns, all armies of your team are destroyed.

title: Marco Polo
description: 1254-1324 An explorer, tradesman or genocide appologist. Marco Polo shaped the cultural perspective of the Mongols for Europeans
effectText: If any Khan is in your memorial, you may call them as reinforcements back onto the field for one turn.

title: Matthew perry
description: 1794-1858 US Naval Imperilaist who pushed Japan to embrace and Open Door Policy. He played a leading role in the relationship with Japan and the West during the Convention of Kanagawa in 1854
effectText: Cancel all effects on the field. Whether from cards summoned, or resource and event cards. As long as this card remains on the field, effects have no effect.

title: Maximilien Robespierre
description: 1758-1794 "Peoples do not judge in the same way as courts of the law; they do not hand down sentneces, they throw thunderbolts" Robespierre was a voice of the Jacobins and led to the Reign of Terror.
effectText: Destroy one Nobility card instantly. This card will destroy 1 army card from THIS field every other turn.

title: Mehmett II
description: 1432-1481 Under his reign, Vlad the Impaler met his demise. Mehmet the Conqueror led the seige of Constantinople in 1453 and further expanded the Ottoman Empire.
effectText: If your oppoonent controls one of your cards- regain control of the card with 2x damage but place it to the memorial after this turn. It does not affect your Player HP.

title: Miguel Hidalgo
description: 1573-1811 A Catholic priest, leader of the MExican War of Independence and recognized as the Father of the Nation of Mexico.
effectText: Grant all Divine and Revolutionist cards +2ATK (excluding this card)

title: Mohandas K Gandhi
description: 1869-1948 Savior to the people of India. He fought for India's independence from the British through the means of Non-violence.
effectText: If any card is in the defensive position when this card is summoned, that card instantly gains full HP. This affect only occurs when this card is brought to the field.

title: Moctezuma II
description: 1466-1520 Ninth Emperor of the Aztec empire, Moctezuma and the Aztec people fell into civil war partially due to the influence of the Spanish Conquistadors.
effectText: If you sacrifice two army cards on your field, you may target one champion to destroy (yours or your opponents)

title: Muhammad prophet of islam
description: 571-632 Muhammad was a scholar, political leader, and founder of Islam. He was approached by the Angel Gabriel and through his travels, spread the word of Allah.
effectText: Destroy all Champion cards on this side of the field, Including this card. Calculate player damage accordingly. (3HP lost max)

title: Nasir al Din Tusi
description: 1201-1274 Philospher and Polymouth, he led to the discovery of trigonometry. His work would influence our understanding of humanity, philosophy, and early evolutionary thought.
effectText: If this card is attacked while in DEF position and you have 3 more more DEF than their ATK stat, the champion loses 2 HP.

title: Nelson Mandela
description: 1918-2013 Nelson Mandela was a political activist who fought against the Appartheid state within South Africa. After being wrongfully imprisoned he would become South Africa's president.
effectText: All scholars and Revolutionists on all sides of the field gain full HP.

title: Norman Borlaug
description: 1914-2009 Norman Borlaug is often associated with the Green Revolution of the 20th century. His work on the agricultural innovations would invigorate the world for 1st and 3rd world countries
effectText: For every turn this card remains on the field it gains +2HP.

title: Pancho Villa
description: 1878-1923 Francisco "Pancho" Villa was a General in the Mexican Revolution. He was a key figure in the revolutionary movement that forced out President Diaz and Brought Madero to power in 1911.
effectText: If any of your cards this game has been destroyed outside of combat, restore player HP accordingly. (i.e. 1 card destroyed- HP restored by 1)

title: Queen Nanny
description: 1688-1733 Grandmother of the maroons, Queen Nany led guerrilla rebellions against the british colonizers.
effectText: This card may attack twice, however it takes 2x damage when targetted.

title: Rumi
description: 1207-1273 "Why should I fear death? What have I lost by death?"  A Persian poet, scholar, and theologian who embraced poetry and spirtuality.
effectText: If any past Foundation cards have been destroyed, you may destroy any card on the field. Next, return one card from your memorial to your deck.

title: Samori Ture
description: 1828-1900 Samori Toure was a Muslim cleric, founder of the Wassolou Empire in modern day Guinea. He fought against French colonizers in 1882.
effectText: Choose one card to be immortal until this card perishes. You may choose this card, but the immortaility lasts for only 2 turns.

title: Tupac Amaru
description: The last Sapa Inca of the Neo-Inca State. Amaru was executed by the Spanish. "Witness how my enemies shed my blood
effectText: When this card perishes in battle, destroy the card that attacked it last

title: Shah Abbas
description: 1571-1629 I ask you... What better way to protect your throne than to sacrifice your children? As the fifth Safavid Shah, he stablized the Persian empire, shtrengthened the economy and connected trhade throughout Asia and Europe.
effectText: If your card was destroyed outside of battle- you may place that card back into your hand

title: Shah Jahan
description: 1592-1666 Jahan was the fifth emperor of the Mughal Empire. He reigned from 1628-1658. Under his emperorship, the mughals reached new feats such as the creatio of the Taj Mahal.
effectText: Double the attack of any number of army cards for 1 turn (you may choose yours or your opponent's). They are then destroyed at the end of this turn.

title: Shaka zulu
description: 1787-1828 Shaka Zulu was the King of the Zulu Kingdom and became one of the most influential monarchs of his people. A vicious ruler or a Savior depending on whose side you were on.
effectText: For every round this card remains on the field, it gains 1 additional ATK

title: Siddhartha Gautama
description: 563-480 BCE The Indian Prince abandoned all he knew to explore the world and find inner peace. His findings would lead to the creaiton of Buddhism after sitting under a tree for 49 days.
effectText: As long as this card remains on the field, after every completed turn you AND your opponent gain +1Player HP

title: Simon Bolivar el libertador
description: 1783-1830 Venezuelan military and political leader who led what are currently the countries of Colombia, Venezuela, Ecuador, Peru, Panam and Bolivia to independence from the Spanish Empire
effectText: If any card on your field has more than one class (divine/fighter etc) they gain full HP. If any opponent has two classes, switch their ATK and DEF stats.

title: Suleiman the Magnificent
description: 1494-1566 Known as "The Judge" Suleiman led to massive military expansion and transformation of the Ottoman Empire.
effectText: Add up all Champion DEF on your side of the arena and use that number as EVERY Champion card's DEF until this card perishes in battle.

title: Sun Yat Sen
description: 1866-1925 Sun yat-sen became the first president of the Republic fo China, instilling the ideas of Nationalism, Rights, and Democracy to the people
effectText: For every foundation type you own, armies gain +1 DEF as long as this card is present on the field.

title: Sundiata keita
description: 1190-1255 Sundiata is often referred to as the Lion King. He was a prince and founder of the Mali Empire. He is also the Grand Uncle of the ruler Mansa Musa.
effectText: If your opponent has any Champion cards that do not require fellow Champions to be on the field, they amy not attack for 2 turns.

title: Tamerlane
description: 1336-1405 First ruler of the Timurid Dynasty and said to be one of the greatest military leaders and tacticians of all time, his empire would expand from Afghanistan, Iran and Parts of Central Asia.
effectText: You intimidate one card on your opponent's playing field into defensive position. They are immobile for one turn.

title: Teddy Roosevelt
description: 1858-1919 Teddy Roosevelt was a war hero, hostiran, philosopher, eugenecist, conservationist, conqueror, diplomat, imperialist. To some a hero of masculinity, to others a monster.
effectText: For every foundation card your opponent controls, add 1 ATK

title: Thomas Hobbes
description: 1588-1679 Hobbes was an English philosopher who described the state of nature as nasty, brutish, and short. His work Leviathan would justify the existence of monarchs throughout the world, insisting man needed to be ruled.
effectText: Instantly destroy one Revolutionist card on your opponent's field. Add +2ATK to all nobility cards on your field.

title: Thomas Paine
description: 1737-1809 "Of all the systems of religion that ever were invented, there is no more derogatory to the Almighty, more unedifying to the man, more repugnant to reason, and more contradictory to itself than this thing called Christianity....
effectText: When this card is placed, banish any opponent's Divine card on the field to the memorial, they lose HP accordingly. As long as this card is on the playing field, no Divine card may be played by either player.

title: Tokugawa Ieyasu
description: 1543-1616 Tokugawa Ieyasu was the founder of the First Shogun of the Tokugawa Shogunate of japan which would reign until 1868 and the Meiji Restoration.
effectText: If any army card stats are below 3, triple that number. As long as this card remains on the field, it affects all cards on this side of the field.

title: Toussaint Louverture
description: 1743-1803 Toussaint fought against the French Government to obtain freedom for the people of Haiti. Hi actions led to his capture under Napoleon and eventual death.
effectText: Either withdraw one resource/event card from the memorial to play again OR cease all current effects on the field.

title: Upton Sinclair
description: 1878-1968 An American author, political activist. His work The Jungle shed light on the food packing industry, however his goal was to criqiue american policy and the struggles immigrants face.
effectText: Add 1 additional ATK, DEF, HP, for every resource card on the field (opponent's included)

title: Yaa Asantewaa
description: 1840-1921A politician, activist, and war hero, she comanded the Ashanti Kings during the war of the GOlden stool and stood against the British colonial rulers.
effectText: Switch all of your opponent's ATK and DEF stats as long as this card remains on the field.

title: Zheng He
description: 1371-1433  Nicknamed the "Three Jewels" Zheng He was an explorer and merchant who brought knowledge of the west to China and vice versa. Once a Mustlim, now one of the greatest explorers of all time.
effectText: Banish all explorers on your opponent's field. Adjust HP accordingly.

title: zheng zhilong
description: 1604-1661 A Christian Chinese diplomat to the Duthc, or a conniving pirate who fought against the COV and loyal subject to the Ming Dynasty
effectText: If your opponent controls more foundation cards than you, draw one foundation card from your deck

title: Zhu Hongdeng
description: A peasant and member of the White Lotus, he would be one of the main "Boxers" during the Boxer Rebellion of 1899-1901
effectText: This card deals 2x damage towards any Nobility Cards.

title: Zhu Yuanzhang
description: 1328-1398 A man of many titles. Peasant, revolutionist, leader of the Ming Dynasty. He provided prosperity to the Empire with the establishment of his secret police force.
effectText: As long as this card remains on the field, your opponent may not place any event/resource cards on their field (face up or face down)
